conclusion: Objects A and B are released and pulled downward by gravity.
Objects C and D are positioned on the left side of the tabletop, while objects E and F are positioned on the right side.
Gravity accelerates objects A and B downward.
Objects C-D (left) and E-F (right) provide the first obstacles in the path of A and B.
Collision with the obstacles removes the downward velocity of A and B.
Objects A and B adjust slightly until the forces from their weight are balanced by normal and frictional forces from the blocks and tabletop.
With no leftover kinetic energy and no unbalanced forces in any horizontal direction, objects A and B come to rest.
Objects A and B finally settle in contact with the blocks and the tabletop, with no further motion occurring.
